cookiesExplanation1: A cookie is a small piece of data that’s stored on your computer, tablet, or phone when you visit a website. Most websites need cookies to work properly.
bulletList1: measure how you use the service so it can be updated and improved based on your needs
remember the notifications you’ve seen so that you’re not shown them again

Find out more about how to manage cookies.

cookiesExplanation10: You may see a pop-up welcome message when you first visit the service. We’ll store a cookie so that your computer knows you’ve seen it and knows not to show it again.

tableData2.name: seen_cookie_message
tableData2.purpose: Saves a message to let us know that you’ve seen our cookie message

cookiesExplanation11: Session cookies are stored on your computer as you travel through a website, and let the website know what you’ve seen and done so far. These are temporary cookies and are automatically deleted a short while after you leave the website.

tableData3.name: session.sid
tableData3.purpose: Carries details of your current session

cookiesExplanation12: We use authentication cookies to identify you when you return to the service.
cookiesExplanation13: We set cookies which prevent attackers from modifying the contents of the other cookies we set. This makes the service more secure and protects your personal information.

tableData5.name: __state
tableData5.purpose: Identifies you to the service and secures your authentication
